turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hey! I need some fashion advice. I'm trying to revamp my wardrobe but I'm on a tight budget, like, *really* tight. Think less than $200 total. Is that even possible?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hi there! Absolutely, it's possible to create a stylish wardrobe on a $200 budget. To give you the best recommendations, could you tell me a bit more about your style preferences and what kind of items you're looking for? For example, are you looking for everyday wear, work attire, or something for special occasions? Also, what is your general size?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, good to hear it's possible! I'm mostly looking for everyday wear, casual stuff. I'm a size medium in tops and a size 8 in pants. I like a pretty minimalist style, you know, basics that I can mix and match. And I prefer neutral colors, like black, white, gray, and maybe some olive green.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Great! Based on your preferences, I would suggest looking into affordable retailers like Target, Old Navy, and H&M. A possible combination could be: A pair of black skinny jeans from Target ($25), a white t-shirt from Old Navy ($10), a gray sweater from H&M ($30) and an olive green jacket from Target ($40). This would give you a solid foundation for your wardrobe at just over $100. Would you like additional options, or a deeper dive into other items?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Wow, that sounds pretty good so far! Can you suggest where to find affordable shoes? I always struggle with finding something that doesn't fall apart after a month. That's where I usually end up blowing my budget. Seriously, shoes are the bane of my existence.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: For affordable and reasonably durable shoes, I recommend checking out stores like DSW or online retailers like Amazon. Search for brands such as: Adidas, Converse or Vans, they often offer affordable sneakers or casual shoes that will last a decent amount of time. Also, I recommend looking for sales on higher quality brands or off-season options. Remember to read reviews to get a better sense of durability. Also, many retailers will provide a discount if you open a store credit card.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, thanks for the advice! I'll check those out. One last question, though: How are these recommendations *actually* personalized to my specific body type? Seems like generic advice so far.
